trial_identification.studytitle: Reducing falls risk in older people discharged from hospital: a randomised controlled trial comparing (i) seated lower limb resistance training, (ii) functional weight-bearing training and (iii) social visits (control activity).
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Reducing falls risk in older people discharged from hospital: a randomised controlled trial comparing (i) seated lower limb resistance training, (ii) functional weight-bearing training and (iii) social visits (control activity).

interventions.interventions: Comparison of 12 week programs of 1) seated resistance training, 2) functional weight-bearing exercises

primaryOutcome.outcome: Quadriceps and other lower limb muscle strength measured using a spring balance and hand-held dynamometer
primaryOutcome.timepoint: Measured at baseline, and at 12 weeks (after completion of the exercise program) and at 24 weeks (to determine detraining)

primaryOutcome.outcome: Postural control/balance measured using a battery of four standardized tests (standing sway on foam, lateral stability, maximal balance range and coordinated stability)
primaryOutcome.timepoint: Measured at baseline, and at 12 weeks (after completion of the exercise program) and at 24 weeks (to determine detraining)

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: Inpatient or consult of the Royal North Shore Hospital Aged Care Department service, inpatient of the General Medical or Neurology Department of RNSH, or inpatient or consult of the Geriatric and Rehabilitation service at Hornsby Hospital.
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: Aged less than 65 years, unable to speak English, medical contraindication to exercise,mobile with at least stand-by assistance and a walking aid, mini-mental state examination score 24 or above, not discharged to nursing home.

trial_design.sequence: Computer generated random numbers using Microsoft excel software. This was done in blocks. There was no stratification
